Box Breathing.source: Balban, M. Y., Neri, E., Kogon, M. M., Weed, L., Nouriani, B., Jo, B., Holl, G., Zeitzer, J. M., Spiegel, D., & Huberman, A. D. (2023). Brief structured respiration practices enhance mood and reduce physiological arousal. Cell reports. Medicine, 4(1), 100895. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.xcrm.2022.100895

Physiological Sighing.source: Balban, M. Y., Neri, E., Kogon, M. M., Weed, L., Nouriani, B., Jo, B., Holl, G., Zeitzer, J. M., Spiegel, D., & Huberman, A. D. (2023). Brief structured respiration practices enhance mood and reduce physiological arousal. Cell reports. Medicine, 4(1), 100895. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.xcrm.2022.100895

steps: Reach arms overhead and stretch for 10 seconds
Stand Up and Stretch.source: Mahindru, A., Patil, P., & Agrawal, V. (2023). Role of Physical Activity on Mental Health and Well-Being: A Review. Cureus, 15(1), e33475. https://doi.org/10.7759/cureus.33475

steps: Take a deep breath in and out
Tense your feel by curling your toes. Pause and notice the feeling
Release the tension and notice the feeling of relaxation
Next, tense your thighs by squeezing your legs together. Pause and notice the feeling
Squeeze your shoulder blades together. Pause
Finally, tense your entire body and hold for a few seconds
Release and let your entire body go limp
Muscle Relaxation.source: Toussaint, L., Nguyen, Q. A., Roettger, C., Dixon, K., Offenb√§cher, M., Kohls, N., Hirsch, J., & Sirois, F. (2021). Effectiveness of Progressive Muscle Relaxation, Deep Breathing, and Guided Imagery in Promoting Psychological and Physiological States of Relaxation. Evidence-based complementary and alternative medicine : eCAM, 2021, 5924040. https://doi.org/10.1155/2021/5924040
